disable: DC 43  Nature  (master) to calm the birds, DC 45  Occultism  (master) to alter your aura, or DC 45  Performance  (master) to imitate the living
markdown:
<title level="1" right="Hazard 18" pfs="">[Avian Rage](/Hazards.aspx?ID=309)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Complex" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=30" />
<trait label="Environmental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=62" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #186: Ghost King's Rage](/Sources.aspx?ID=189) pg. 11</row>

**Complexity** Complex

</column>

Hundreds of panicked whippoorwills swarm through the area.

---

**Stealth**
+45 (master)

**Disable**
DC 43 [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) (master) to calm the birds, DC 45 [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) (master) to alter your aura, or DC 45 [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12) (master) to imitate the living

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

**Panic!** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([sonic](/Traits.aspx?ID=147)) **Trigger** An [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) or a creature with [negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42) enters the garden; **Effect** The birds screech in panic, dealing 3d12+20 sonic damage to all creatures in the garden (DC 44 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save). On a failure, the creature becomes [stunned 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=36) (stunned 3 on a critical failure). The trap then rolls initiative.

---
**Routine**
(1 action) The birds swarm wildly through the garden, pecking and slashing at all undead creatures and creatures with negative healing in the garden, dealing 3d10+20 slashing damage and 1d10 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) (DC 44 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).

---
**Reset**
The trap deactivates and resets if 1 minute passes without any undead or creatures with negative healing in the garden.
name: Avian Rage
reset: The trap deactivates and resets if 1 minute passes without any undead or creatures with negative healing in the garden.
